content:
Add Conditions to a FlexCard Element

You can display or hide data based on the value of a data field. For example, display an alert icon or supplemental text for escalated Cases. Apply conditions to any element listed in the Build panel of the FlexCard Designer.

To add a condition to an element, select the element from the canvas and click +Add New next to Conditions in the Properties panel. On an action on an event listener or individual actions on the Menu element, click Setup, click + Add New in the Event Listener section, and click +Add New next to Conditions.

Beginning Winter '22, deselect the Preload Conditional Component checkbox to improve performance on conditional elements.

Click + Add Condition. Create basic conditions by clicking Data Field, selecting a data field to filter, choosing an Operator, and entering a value to check against. For example, select Status for a Case record, choose =, and enter Escalated.

If adding another condition, click + Add Condition and select AND or OR between conditions. Select AND if all conditions must be met. Select OR if any condition can be met.

Click + Add Group after creating a condition to build nested conditions. Click + Add Condition and enter values for all fields for each condition. Select AND or OR from the dropdown between conditions.

The properties for conditions are configurable for all elements in the Properties panel in the FlexCard Designer. Conditionally display FlexCard elements based on the value of a data field.

DID THIS ARTICLE SOLVE YOUR ISSUE?
Yes
No
title: Adding Conditions to FlexCards
